frameDefinitions: This frame contains verbs and nouns that communicate the act of a Speaker to address a Message to some Addressee using language.
A Fire burns Fuel, resulting in damage and possibly complete destruction of the Fuel.

This frame involves a static (primarily spatial) relationship between a Location and a Theme, in which the Theme is located in many or all subregions of the Location, and is thus construable as covering it.
An Agent or Cause makes a New_member part of  Group.
An Event with multiple Participants takes place.
A member or members of a Class have just been  mentioned or are present in the discourse setting and now a different instance  (or group of instances) of the same class is referred to.
frameExamples: I now <t>declare</t> you members of this Society.
A fire that started on Saturday afternoon, the High Glade Fire - located on the Mendocino National Forest's Upper Lake Ranger District - continued to <t>burn</t> actively on Sunday.
I <t>added</t> a new rock to my collection.
MATAC looks forward to your <t>participation</t> in helping promote telework in the Mid-Atlantic region.
My husband left me for <t>another</t> woman -- and now wants to get back together again!
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that produces the <fen>Message</fen> (whether spoken or written).  It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the <t>target	</t> word, or as the Genitive modifier of the noun.
The <fen>Message</fen> is the role that identifies the content of what the <fen>Speaker</fen> is communicating to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.  It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about', but in some cases it can appear as a direct object.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Message</fen> is made.
The role specifies the location where the <fen>Message</fen> takes place.

The total material currently involved in combustion, including both the parts of the <fen>Fuel</fen> currently undergoing chemical alteration and the partially ionized gas that results from this process.
The entity that is undergoing rapid chemical alteration leading to damage or destruction.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Fire</fen> is burning.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Fire</fen> is burning.

The <fen>Theme</fen> in this frame is the object which is described as standing in some spatial relation to a particular <fen>Location</fen>.  <fen>Theme</fen> typically occurs as the External Argument or, with passives, as a PP Complement headed by 'with' or 'by'.
<fen>Location</fen> is the entity or area with respect to which the <fen>Theme</fen>'s spatial arrangement is described.  This frame element generally occurs as an NP Object.
The time at which the <fen>Theme</fen> occupies the <fen>Location</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is a volitional animate being who causes the <fen>New_member</fen> to become part of the <fen>Group</fen>.
Something that is already a member of the <fen>Group</fen> and represents the <fen>Group</fen> as a whole.
An item that becomes a part of the <fen>Group</fen>.

The <fen>Group</fen> is anything that can be conceptualized as a complex collection of parts or ingredients, including through metonymy like containers or locations, which <fen>New_member</fen>s can join.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that is responsible for causing a <fen>New_member</fen> to enter a <fen>Group</fen>.
This role identifies when the inclusion of the <fen>New_member</fen> to the <fen>Group</fen> occurs.
The location in which a <fen>New_member</fen> is entered into a pre-existing <fen>Group</fen>.
The individuals or entities that have been participants in an <fen>Event</fen>.
<fen>Participant_1</fen> is the grammatically more prominent participant in an <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>.
A grammatically less prominent participant of an <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>.
An <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>, who may or may not be involved intentionally.
A group, location, or institution conventionally associated with an <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the multiple-participant <fen>Event</fen> occurs.
The location where the <fen>Event</fen> involving multiple <fen>Participants</fen> occurs.
The general category of entity which has been referred to.
The instance of the <fen>Class</fen> that is added to the <fen>Initial_set</fen> of entities in the <fen>Class</fen>.
The previously mentioned group of entities of the <fen>Class</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Evelyn</fex> spoke feelingly about what happened.
Evelyn said <fex>that she was not ready to leave</fex>.
Evelyn spoke candidly <fex>about her past</fex>.
Kim preached to me <fex>over the phone</fex>.
In some remarks <fex>at the National Press Club</fex>, Mr. Keating said he would make a better prime minister tha nMr. Hawke.
<fex>Ribbons</fex> festooned the car.
Thick varnish coated <fex>the beautiful wood</fex>.
<fex>By 1950</fex>, factories dotted the adjacent countryside.
<fex>Matt</fex> seems to add new work to his flickr most days.
The companyincludes philanthropic endeavors in their accomplishments
<fex>The calls of crows</fex> added an eerie aspect to the atmosphere of our date.
Thereafter, <fex>everybody</fex> participated in the 17 May parade ending in the Nordic Club.
Last year, <fex>Bill</fex> participated in the Montana State University Earth Systems Science distance learning course in the Atmosphere Unit.

The Second Amended Complaint alleges that Andrew S. Pitt ('Pitt'), Conectisys Corporation ('Conectisys' or the 'Company'), and BM
Capital Corp. participated <fex>with Zaman and Smith Benton</fex> in a fraudulent and manipulative trading scheme.
Some who participated <fex>in D-Day</fex> are finally ready to talk about it
Several of the countries were unable to participate <fex>in the market</fex> .

A survey of students who participated <fex>last year</fex> showed that 61 percent would be the
first in their family to attend college.
The most exciting tours for Mr. Osako were when he participated <fex>in France, Belgium, Holland, Cuba and Japan</fex>.
My Husband left me for another <fex>man</fex>!
There was <fex><t>another</t> power outage</fex> today.
A further five incursions <fex>over and above those noted for 1995</fex> took place in the first three months of 1996.
